title: 113_hr5113
content: The Act is titled "Protecting Seniors' Medicare Choices from Obamacare Act of 2014". It eliminates PPACA enhanced Medicaid FMAP for prisoners and reallocates savings to Medicare Advantage Improvement Fund. The Act "Protecting Seniors' Medicare Choices from Obamacare Act of 2014" eliminates PPACA enhanced Medicaid FMAP for prisoners. The Act "Protecting Seniors' Medicare Choices from Obamacare Act of 2014" eliminates PPACA enhanced Medicaid FMAP for prisoners. The amendments made by paragraph (1) apply to items and services furnished on or after January 1, 2015. A Medicare Advantage stabilization program is established for 2015 to address beneficiary plan inadequacies. In 2015, a Medicare Advantage plan must meet certain criteria to be eligible, including increased beneficiary costs compared to the previous year. In 2015, Medicare Advantage plans must meet specific criteria to be eligible, such as reduced supplemental benefits and a smaller provider network compared to 2014. The Secretary will distribute PMPM stabilization funding amounts to eligible plans by December 31, 2014. The Secretary will determine a PMPM stabilization funding amount for eligible Medicare Advantage plans for plan year 2015, based on the projected enrollment of individuals in the plan. This funding is intended to address the needs of the plan for the specified year. The Secretary will determine the PMPM stabilization funding amount for eligible Medicare Advantage plans for plan year 2015, not exceeding $85 per member per month. The determination will be made by October 15, 2014, to address beneficiary plan inadequacies. The Secretary will determine funding for eligible Medicare Advantage plans, not exceeding $3 billion from the general fund until December 31, 2015. Payments under the stabilization program will not be considered. The stabilization program will not affect premium payments under part B.
